awd_abstract_narration: This is a study of the relaxation mechanisms in highly non-                     equilibrium glass structures. X-ray diffraction, Raman and Infrared             spectroscopy, and Differential Scanning Calorimetry will be used to             follow structural changes during annealing of rapidly quenched                  germania, boria, and silica glass fibers. The experimental results              will be analyzed using a new phenomenological model which will be               derived to address the inadequacies of current equilibrium models               for highly non-equilibrium systems. The improved model together                 with data on structural changes and the corresponding enthalpy                  relaxation will lead to a better understanding of the microscopic               mechanisms in structural relaxation phenomenon in oxide glasses.                Understanding relaxation is essential for the development of new                important glasses for the communication technology.
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Mathematical and Physical Sciences
